post_text: Wearing facial coverings has become an integral part of returning to school in 2020. Mrs. Bucco, one of our school nurses, reviews proper masking procedures in this video. Please watch this with your kids to help them get comfortable with the best practices for using a face covering in school. For those who wish to request an exemption you may view the entire Ohio Department of Health order and Champion Schools "Request For Waiver Under Face Coverings/Mask Policy" on our district web site. Stay Safe Flashes! #WeAreChampionStrong #BeWellTogether

post_text: Please join us this Wednesday at 6:30 P.M. for a Town Hall to discuss the opening of school this year. The meeting will be held on the Champion Local Schools Facebook page.
text: Please join us this Wednesday at 6:30 P.M. for a Town Hall to discuss the opening of school this year. The meeting will be held on the Champion Local Schools Facebook page.

post_text:
This is John Grabowski, Superintendent of Champion Local Schools



On Thursday of last week, Governor DeWine released recommendations from the Ohio Department of Health and the Ohio Department of Education for schools to return in the fall. We have been working on several plans for Champion Schools “Return to Learn.” We used the results of the previous surveys to help with those preliminary plans. We are now working with our stakeholders on finalizing those plans, and we will be able to share them with you in the coming weeks. Please be patient, many of the preliminary guidelines released to the schools were updated and changed as the virus spread began to grow and we need to work to align our plans to those changes.



Our best to all of you during these difficult times, stay safe and we remain Champion Strong!
text:
This is John Grabowski, Superintendent of Champion Local Schools



On Thursday of last week, Governor DeWine released recommendations from the Ohio Department of Health and the Ohio Department of Education for schools to return in the fall. We have been working on several plans for Champion Schools “Return to Learn.” We used the results of the previous surveys to help with those preliminary plans. We are now working with our stakeholders on finalizing those plans, and we will be able to share them with you in the coming weeks. Please be patient, many of the preliminary guidelines released to the schools were updated and changed as the virus spread began to grow and we need to work to align our plans to those changes.



Our best to all of you during these difficult times, stay safe and we remain Champion Strong!

CHAMPIONLOCAL.ORG
Superintendent's Message July 7

post_text:
This is John Grabowski, Superintendent of Champion Local Schools

I wanted to remind all parents that we will be passing out food to those in need from 12-1 and 6-7 every Tuesday in front of the Elementary school.

The Transportation Survey for next school year will be available on line until Wednesday, June 10th. Please fill out the survey at www.championlocal.org/bus if you have not already done so.

Just a reminder, if you have not turned in your child’s chromebook, hot spot or other items for this school year, you can still drop them off Tuesdays from 12-1 and 6-7 PM in front of the Elementary School. This is the time of year where service and maintenance occurs. If they are not returned in a timely fashion we will be forced to send them out for repair and a fee will be assessed for the service.

I hope you and your family have a relaxing summer, stay safe and we all remain Champion Strong!

June 8th Superintendent's Message

post_text:
Please respond to our online busing survey that will be used solely to identify how many bus riders we can expect for the upcoming school year.

Please answer as accurately as possible. Assume that the school year will begin with social distancing measures in place due to the COVID-19 virus. Please complete only ONE survey per household/family no later than Wednesday, June 10, 2020.

The link to complete the survey online is www.championlocal.org/bus.
text:
Please respond to our online busing survey that will be used solely to identify how many bus riders we can expect for the upcoming school year.

Please answer as accurately as possible. Assume that the school year will begin with social distancing measures in place due to the COVID-19 virus. Please complete only ONE survey per household/family no later than Wednesday, June 10, 2020.

The link to complete the survey online is www.championlocal.org/bus.

post_text:
This is John Grabowski, Superintendent of Champion Local Schools

I wanted to take a moment to remind everyone that we will be passing out food to those in need on Tuesday’s throughout the summer. We will be adjusting the times slightly. Food will be passed out now from 12-1 and 6-7 PM.

Also, we will be sending out a survey this week by email, social media and mail to help us know how many students will need transported by bus next year. No decisions for next year have been finalized. This data will help with the decision making process as guidance becomes available.

Just a reminder, both the Middle School and High School are collecting books and chromebooks this week. Please review the dates and times to drop off your child’s items to the schools. It is very important for chromebooks to be dropped off this week so our staff can begin updating the software and prepare them for next year.

Thank you for your continued support. Have a great night, stay safe and we remain Champion Strong!
text:
This is John Grabowski, Superintendent of Champion Local Schools

I wanted to take a moment to remind everyone that we will be passing out food to those in need on Tuesday’s throughout the summer. We will be adjusting the times slightly. Food will be passed out now from 12-1 and 6-7 PM.

Also, we will be sending out a survey this week by email, social media and mail to help us know how many students will need transported by bus next year. No decisions for next year have been finalized. This data will help with the decision making process as guidance becomes available.

Just a reminder, both the Middle School and High School are collecting books and chromebooks this week. Please review the dates and times to drop off your child’s items to the schools. It is very important for chromebooks to be dropped off this week so our staff can begin updating the software and prepare them for next year.

Thank you for your continued support. Have a great night, stay safe and we remain Champion Strong!

CHAMPIONLOCAL.ORG
June 1st District Phone Update

post_text: Champion Schools will be hosting a second town-hall meeting on Monday at 6:00 PM to discuss end of the year procedures, upcoming senior events and activities and beginning discussions for next school year for all three buildings. Invitations will be sent out on Monday by email around 3:00 PM.
text: Champion Schools will be hosting a second town-hall meeting on Monday at 6:00 PM to discuss end of the year procedures, upcoming senior events and activities and beginning discussions for next school year for all three buildings. Invitations will be sent out on Monday by email around 3:00 PM.

post_text:
This is John Grabowski, Superintendent of Champion Local Schools
I know there are many questions that you probably have today from the Governors announcement. Our administrative team will begin working to finalize our plans for the end of the year and we will hold another town hall meeting next week to address your concerns. Please follow our facebook, instagram and school webpages for more details.

Tonight from 8:20 to 8:40, Champion Schools will be lighting the Champion Stadium to honor the Class of 2020 from 8:20 to 8:40. The stadium will be closed, but students and families may drive around to see it. You may enter the PK-8 entrance and drive around and behind the stadium. We must maintain social distancing and no one will be allowed to get out of their cars.

We will be holding our food pick up tomorrow from 12-2 and 6-7 pm in front of the PK-8 Building. You may drop off any donations at that time as well.
Stay Safe and have a good night.
We are Champion Strong.

Happy Easter, everyone!

text:
Happy Easter, everyone!

#WeAreChampion

post_text:
I hope everyone has had a productive week of online learning. I want to remind everyone that we have WiFi hotspots to give to families that do not have reliable internet access at home. If you would like one, please call and leave a message at 330-847-2338. Beginning next week, we will be changing our food distribution day to Tuesday from now on. Times will be the same from 12-2 and 6-7 PM. We will accept donations for the food pantry again during this same time.

I wanted to let all parents know that have lost their jobs due to the Covid-19, you can still apply for the free and reduced lunch program while we are closed on our food services website. This program can also help cover the cost for workbook and other fees through the school. I know this is not the way we had planned to spend Easter and spring break, but I hope we can all enjoy time with the ones we love together or remotely and remember that this will not last forever. My best to you and your families. As always, we remain Champion Strong! Have a good night!
text:
I hope everyone has had a productive week of online learning. I want to remind everyone that we have WiFi hotspots to give to families that do not have reliable internet access at home. If you would like one, please call and leave a message at 330-847-2338. Beginning next week, we will be changing our food distribution day to Tuesday from now on. Times will be the same from 12-2 and 6-7 PM. We will accept donations for the food pantry again during this same time.

I wanted to let all parents know that have lost their jobs due to the Covid-19, you can still apply for the free and reduced lunch program while we are closed on our food services website. This program can also help cover the cost for workbook and other fees through the school. I know this is not the way we had planned to spend Easter and spring break, but I hope we can all enjoy time with the ones we love together or remotely and remember that this will not last forever. My best to you and your families. As always, we remain Champion Strong! Have a good night!

CHAMPIONLOCAL.ORG
Superintendent's Update

post_text:
Attention Parents,

With all the recent changes, I would like to offer an opportunity for you to attend a virtual meeting to share more information and give you a chance to ask questions about our district practices moving forward.

This meeting will be held online using Zoom tomorrow night from 6:30-7:30 P.M. You can dial in to participate or login on your phone, chromebook or computer. Zoom is a meeting tool that many of our teachers have begun to use to communicate to your students and more will begin to use in the weeks to come.

Our technology coordinator will be sending you the link on how to join the meeting. You will have a chance to ask questions either by audio or through the chat feature, and I will explain how that works once we begin.

If we do not have your updated email address in FinalForms, please email me your new address so we can include you in the email tomorrow. My email is john.grabowski@championlocal.org

Hope to see you tomorrow night for our virtual chat.
Respectfully,

John Grabowski
Superintendent
Champion Local Schools

post_text:
Attention all students, families, and community members,

Until further notice, all athletic fields and playgrounds on school property are closed. This decision has been made in the best interest of our community to encourage social distancing and limit potential spread of the Covid-19 virus. The all-weather track will remain open at this time, as long as everyone visiting the track can follow the rules of social distancing set forth by Governor DeWine. Thank you all for your understanding!

#WeAreChampion #TogetherAsOne #WeAreChampionStrong ⚡️⚡️

This will continue every Monday until we are back to school.

post_text:
With recent developments and increasing concerns related to the coronavirus, our district has been working with the Trumbull County Board of Health and other local officials to ensure the health, safety, and wellbeing of all of our students.

As a county, we have established steps to determine when a school should be closed because of illness. We have a plan in place to communicate information to parents, students, staff and the community about any school closings and the processes for cleaning, disinfecting and, if necessary, decontaminating facilities.

We have created a website with all the resources that have been provided to us regarding the Covid-19 virus. You can access them at www.championlocal.org/covid19.

post_text: The Champion Board of Education Honored our Elementary School and Middle School Spelling Bee Winners at last nights monthly meeting. Mrs. Fisher, Board President, recognizes Treasurer Laurena Rouan with the “Auditor of the State Award” for the third year consecutive year. Mr. Paul Burke, CMS 7th Grade Girls Basketball Coach is recognized for winning his 100th game. Emilie Brocious, CHS Junior, updates the Board on the service activities being done by the student leadership groups at CHS. Congratulations to all!! What makes Champion Great? WE DO!! #WeAreChampion #TogetherAsOne ⚡️⚡️
